definitions.definition: The upper portion of a page (or other) layout.
definitions.example: If you reduce the header of this document, the body will fit onto a single page.

definitions.definition: Text, or other visual information, used to mark off a quantity of text, often titling or summarizing it.
definitions.example: Your header is too long; "Local Cannibals" will suffice.

definitions.definition: Text, or other visual information, that goes at the top of a column of information in a table.
definitions.example: That column should have the header "payment status".

definitions.definition: A font, text style, or typesetting used for any of the above.
definitions.example: Parts of speech belong in a level-three header. Level-two headers are reserved for the name of the language.

definitions.definition: The first part of a file or record that describes its contents.
definitions.example: The header includes an index, an identifier, and a pointer to the next entry.

definitions.definition: The first part of a packet or stream, often containing its address and descriptors.
definitions.example: The encapsulation layer adds an eight-byte header and a two-byte trailer to each packet.

definitions.definition: A brick that is laid sideways at the top of a wall or within the brickwork with the short side showing.
definitions.example: This wall has four header courses.

definitions.definition: A horizontal structural or finish piece over an opening.
A machine that separates and gathers the heads of grain etc.
definitions.example: They fed the bale into the header.

definitions.definition: The act of hitting the ball with the head.
definitions.example: His header for the goal followed a perfect corner kick.
The clown tripped over the other clown and took a header.

definitions.definition: A raised tank that supplies water at constant pressure, especially to a central heating and hot water system.
A pipe which connects several smaller pipes.
definitions.example: Common practice is to use plastic pipes with iron headers.

definitions.definition: The rodeo performer who drives the steer toward the heeler to be tied.
One who puts a head on something.
To strike (a ball) with one's head.
A file, usually in the form of source code, that is automatically included in another source file by the compiler.
A file that contains declarations but no implementations.
